newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine June industrial output up 10.7 pct - FIEL.
newsitem.headline: Argentine June industrial output up 10.7 pct - FIEL.

text.p: Argentina's industrial output in June was 10.7 percent higher than June 1996, while output for the first half of 1997 was 8.3 percent higher than first-half 1996, the private consultancy FIEL said Monday.
The industrial production figure for June was 3.4 percent down on May, which FIEL said in a statement was "explained almost exclusively by seasonal factors (the lower number of working days)."

The consultancy said the sharp June-June increase was "the product of a low basis for comparison" since June 1996 was hit by a general strike led by the CGT labor federation which hurt production levels.
FIEL said the second quarter of the year showed an 8.5 percent rise in industrial output on the first quarter, when growth was also high at 8.1 percent.

"It is the fifth consecutive quarter in which the level of activity is higher than the same period the year before," said FIEL, which was revising preliminary data released last week that showed a 9.9 percent June-to-June output increase.

Government industrial output data released last week showed a 9.8 percent June-to-June increase and a 7.9 percent rise for the first half against first-half 1996. The official data showed a seasonally-adjusted 0.9 percent rise on May and a non seasonally-adjusted 1.4 percent fall from May.
